Package net.xqhs.util.logging

Class MasterLog

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.xqhs.util.logging.MasterLog
  • public class MasterLog
extends java.lang.Object
    The class manages static, global settings that span over all logs. Among these are:
    • setting the default Level for new logs
    • setting global performance mode and management of performance mode elements, namely the thread and queue used for processing logging messages.

    It contains a singleton Unit (the "master" unit) which is added automatically as parent to all logs.

    Author:
    Andrei Olaru

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      protected static Logger.Level defaultLevel
      The default level for newly-created logs.
      protected static boolean GLOBAL_PERFORMANCE_MODE
      The global switch for performance mode.
      protected static Unit masterLog
      The unit which is given as parent to all logs.
      protected static java.util.concurrent.LinkedBlockingQueue<Unit.LogEntry> processingQueue
      For performance mode, this stores the messages that need to be posted to the log.
      protected static java.lang.Thread processingThread
      For logs in performance mode, this is the thread that processes the logging messages.
      protected static long TIME_STEP
      For logs in performance mode, this is the (minimum) time between writings to the output, in milliseconds.

    • Field Detail

      • defaultLevel

        protected static Logger.Level defaultLevel
        The default level for newly-created logs.

      • masterLog

        protected static Unit masterLog
        The unit which is given as parent to all logs.

      • GLOBAL_PERFORMANCE_MODE

        protected static boolean GLOBAL_PERFORMANCE_MODE
        The global switch for performance mode. This can be switched to true only before any logging begins.

        Afterwards, individual logs can be set to performance mode, before they begin any logging.

        The global performance mode cannot be disabled.

      • processingQueue

        protected static java.util.concurrent.LinkedBlockingQueue<Unit.LogEntry> processingQueue
        For performance mode, this stores the messages that need to be posted to the log.

        The availability of the performance mode itself is indicated by the fact that the queue is not null.

      • processingThread

        protected static java.lang.Thread processingThread
        For logs in performance mode, this is the thread that processes the logging messages.

      • TIME_STEP

        protected static long TIME_STEP
        For logs in performance mode, this is the (minimum) time between writings to the output, in milliseconds.

    • Method Detail

      • setLogLevel

        public static void setLogLevel​(Logger.Level level)
        The level of the master unit, which may propagate to other logs.
        Parameters:
        level - - the Logger.Level.

      • getDefaultLevel

        public static Logger.Level getDefaultLevel()
        Returns:
        the current default level for newly-created logs.

      • setDefaultLogLevel

        public static Logger.Level setDefaultLogLevel​(Logger.Level level)
        Changes the default level for newly-created logs. There is no effect on already existing logs.
        Parameters:
        level - - the new default level.
        Returns:
        the previous default level.

      • isGlobalPerformanceModeSet

        public static boolean isGlobalPerformanceModeSet()
        Returns:
        the global performance mode.

      • activateGlobalPerformanceMode

        public static void activateGlobalPerformanceMode()
        Activates the global performance mode. This can be switched to true only before any logging begins.

        Afterwards, individual logs can be set to performance mode, before they begin any logging.

        The global performance mode cannot be disabled.

      • enablePerformanceModeTools

        public static void enablePerformanceModeTools()
        This has to be called (and is called by Unit) whenever there exists a log that needs performance mode.

      • enablePerformanceModeTools

        public static void enablePerformanceModeTools​(long loggingPeriod)
        Same as enablePerformanceModeTools(), but allows setting the period at which log messages are processed.

        This is a minimum, it may be that more time passes between processing chunks of messages.

        Parameters:
        loggingPeriod - - the minimal time from one stage of processing to the next.

      • processQueue

        protected static void processQueue()
        Processes the logging entries so far.

      • processAll

        protected static void processAll()

      • doExit

        public static void doExit()

      • closePerformaceElements

        protected static void closePerformaceElements()
